segment.source: How to add and deploy the Internet Explorer 11 update using Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: How to add and deploy the Internet Explorer 11 update using Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Install Internet Explorer 11 (IE11) using Microsoft Intune (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Install Internet Explorer 11 (IE11) using Microsoft Intune (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Install Internet Explorer 11 (IE11) using Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Install Internet Explorer 11 (IE11) using Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Internet Explorer 11 is available as an update in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Internet Explorer 11 is available as an update in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Microsoft Intune uses Windows cloud services to help you manage updates, monitor and protect your computers, provide remote assistance, track hardware and software inventory, and set security policies.
segment.target: Microsoft Intune uses Windows cloud services to help you manage updates, monitor and protect your computers, provide remote assistance, track hardware and software inventory, and set security policies.

segment.source: For more information, see the Documentation Library for Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see the Documentation Library for Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Adding and deploying the IE11 package
segment.target: Adding and deploying the IE11 package

segment.source: You can add and then deploy the IE11 package to any computer that's managed by Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: You can add and then deploy the IE11 package to any computer that's managed by Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: To add the IE11 package
segment.target: To add the IE11 package

segment.source: From the Microsoft Intune administrator console, start the Microsoft Intune Software Publisher.
segment.target: From the Microsoft Intune administrator console, start the Microsoft Intune Software Publisher.

segment.source: Add your IE11 package as either an external link or as a Windows installer package (.exe or .msi).
segment.target: Add your IE11 package as either an external link or as a Windows installer package (.exe or .msi).

segment.source: For more info about how to decide which one to use, and how to use it, see Deploy and configure apps.
segment.target: For more info about how to decide which one to use, and how to use it, see Deploy and configure apps.

segment.source: To automatically deploy and install the IE11 package
segment.target: To automatically deploy and install the IE11 package

segment.source: From the Microsoft Intune administrator console, start and run through the Deploy Software wizard.
segment.target: From the Microsoft Intune administrator console, start and run through the Deploy Software wizard.

segment.source: Deploy the package to any of your employee computers that are managed by Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Deploy the package to any of your employee computers that are managed by Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: After the package is on your employee's computers, the installation process runs, based on what you set up in your wizard.
segment.target: After the package is on your employee's computers, the installation process runs, based on what you set up in your wizard.

segment.source: For more info about this, see Deploy and configure apps.
segment.target: For more info about this, see Deploy and configure apps.

segment.source: To let your employees install the IE11 package
segment.target: To let your employees install the IE11 package

segment.source: Install the package on your company's Microsoft Intune site, marking it as Available for the appropriate groups.
segment.target: Install the package on your company's Microsoft Intune site, marking it as Available for the appropriate groups.

segment.source: Any employee in the assigned group can now install the package.
segment.target: Any employee in the assigned group can now install the package.

segment.source: For more info about this, see Update apps using Microsoft Intune
segment.target: For more info about this, see Update apps using Microsoft Intune
